question.text:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).
Assertion (A) : Metallic character decreases and non-metallic character increases on moving from left to right in a period.
Reason (R): It is due to increase in ionisation enthalpy and decrease in electron gain enthalpy, when one moves from left to right in a period.
In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

options.text: Both <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></mfenced></math> are correct and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></mfenced></math> is the correct explanation of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mfenced></math>

Both <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></mfenced></math> are correct but <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></mfenced></math> is not the correct explanation of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mfenced></math>.

solution.text: It is due to increase in ionisation enthalpy and increases in electron gain enthalpy, when one moves from left to right in a period.
